title: Prosecutor Says Three Former Officers ‘Chose to Do Nothing’ in George Floyd Arrest
sub_head: Case charging officers with civil-rights violations is headed to a jury after one month of testimony
body:
A federal prosecutor said three former Minneapolis police officers “chose to do nothing” to help George Floyd during closing arguments Tuesday as their monthlong trial over violating his civil rights neared making its way to the jury.
The three former officers—Tou Thao, J. Alexander Kueng and Thomas Lane—are charged with failing to provide medical aid to Mr. Floyd as he lay face down in the street for more than nine minutes as former officer Derek Chauvin knelt on his neck and back.
